description.narrative:
1. Four sets of events designed for increasing the awareness and forging mutual understandings among the targeted multiple stakeholders.
2. One training program/knowledge sharing/capacity building session for stakeholders in both Ethiopia and China to increase the understanding and awareness of ESG as well as principles, standards related to sustainable investment.
3. One online information hub that facilitate local needs to match investment opportunities and reduce transaction costs.
4. A diagnostic study on ESG/ sustainability aspects of Investment promotion and facilitation.
5. Five concrete policy advices designed to analyze and help remove investors’ related barriers and improve investment climate.
6. One priority sector and / or one pilot project with value-chain approach identified and selected for participating in the de-risking analysis or project assessment on development aspects.
7. Five concrete project-level advices designed to improve the sustainability level and scale of the pilot project and to build the capacity and knowledge of the project managers in the field.
8. Three successful practices summarized to demonstrate the sustainable impacts of the pilot project on development aspects to local, Chinese and international audiences, and to explore future cooperation aspects for scaling up / replicating.

5. Limited analysis/policy advice in specific investment sector.
6. Limited policy advisory services provided on social and environmental aspects for pilot BRI-SIP projects.
7. Limited assessment on development impacts of BRI-SIP projects.
8. Limited advocacy services on BRI-SIP.

A set of diagnostic studies on sustainable investment in Ethiopia is aimed to be developed in 2020, which include:
1. One study endorsed on sustainability aspects of Investment promotion and facilitation.
2. One knowledge product produced on macro level investment barriers and challenges.
3. One sector based de-risking investment analysis produced.
